results.title: Discipline: Giving orders
results.brief_description: A Navy training film promoting the idea that staff discipline is the function of a co-operative management style. Includes some illuminating footage of model clerical workplaces and an involuntary endorsment of Coca-Cola.

results.title: Discipline during adolescence
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Adolescent Development”.
Discusses the age-old question of how much discipline is good for adolescents. Results of too much and too little parental control are dramatized in a typical family setting.

results.title: Discipline and self control (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: National Audio Visual Center and J Stone
results.brief_description: Discusses the problem of discipline as one of teaching and living with young children. Shows how a teacher can establish control in a friendly climate and prevent disciplinary problems; discusses adequate supervision, the dangers of over and under control and how to help a child accept control. Filmed at various schools in the United States.

results.title: Discipline 2
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
PGR Looks at why we discipline our children and the ways we do it, suggesting guidelines for starting the process with young children. Using dramatisations we look at the problem of aggressive behaviour and how to solve it without parents resorting to aggressive behaviour themselves.

results.title: Discipline
results.brief_description: Parents, teachers and psychologists look at this age-old problem. They discuss how to discipline effectively, whether corporal punishment works, problems faced by today’s teachers, negotiating with a child and how discipline can become abuse.

results.title: Discharge through gases
results.brief_description: Using experiments, animation and diagrams, this film shows and explains discharge patterns in rarefied gases. Studies the phenomena produced inside a glass tube fitted with two electrodes when a high voltage is applied and the air pressure in the tube is reduced by a vacuum pump. Starting from spark discharge in air, the parts of discharge are identified; deflection of cathode rays by magnetic or electrostatic fields, ionization by collision, breakdown voltage and excitation of the atom by free electrons are explained.
results.description: Using experiments, animation and diagrams, this film shows and explains discharge patterns in rarefied gases. results.title: Disasters: national preparedness
results.creator_credit: Peter Johnston, Film Australia, Natural Disasters Organisation (Australia) and Greg Reading
results.brief_description: Shows the work of the Natural Disasters Organisation. A simulated exercise to show the co-ordination of relief lines involves a cyclone and an earthquake in separate locations in Western Australia.

results.title: Disaster fly
results.brief_description: If the screw fly entered Australia the cost to the cattle and sheep industries would be high. The screw worm fly is a danger to all warm-blooded animals, including man, and begins its cycle in flesh wounds. Papua New Guinea is the only screw worm-infected country near Australia, and it is pursuing research into control of this pest

results.title: Disappearing world revisited. Ep. 3
results.creator_credit: Granada Television International and Kathryn Ferguson
results.brief_description: This three part series made for the Discovery Channel draws its material from the landmark Disappearing World documentary series produced by Granada Television in the 1970s. With each of over fifty episodes supervised by an anthropologist, the series set out to record the way of life of indigenous peoples around the world whose traditional cultures were under threat. Each episode of “Disappearing world revisited” briefly recaps three of these original stories then provides a short overview of the situation of the tribal peoples today. The three stories revisited in Episode 3 are: 1. “Kataragama”: In Sri Lanka, worshippers of the god Kataragama perform extreme feats of devotion. 2. “The Kirghiz of Afghanistan” Looks at the harsh life of the Kirghiz who live in the Pamir region of Afghanistan on the highest plateau in the world at 15,000 feet between the closed borders of Pakistan, China and Russia. 3. “Embera: The End of the Road”: The traditional life of the river people of Colombia is threatened by a new major highway, and exploitation by traders. Presented by Andy Kershaw.
